parse_maker_id()¶

Not sure what kind do data should be parsed. But it should be unique enough in the source site.

Return type

str

parse_name()¶

Parse product name

Return type

str

parse_category()¶

There might be several kinks of category, but this project is focusing on scaled-figure currently.

Return type

str

parse_manufacturer()¶

Parse manufacturer

Return type

str

parse_prices()¶

Parse latest price and past prices Order of prices should follow their release_dates.

Use Price. Should check including-tax or not when parsing.

Return type

List[int]

parse_release_dates()¶

Parse latest release date and past dates.

This order should be followed by prices.

Return type

List[date]

parse_scale()¶

The result should be the denominator of scale:

  • 1/8 -> 8

  • 1/7 -> 7

  • Others -> None

Return type

Optional[int]

parse_sculptors()¶

This project respect sculptors, please try your best to parse all scultpors.

Because there would be serveral formats used to present sculptors.

Return type

List[str]

parse_series()¶

Parse series of product

Return type

Optional[str]

parse_size()¶

The unit is mm

Return type

Optional[int]

parse_paintworks()¶

This project respect paintworks, please try your best to parse all paintworks.

Because there would be serveral formats used to present paintworks.

Return type

List[str]

parse_releaser()¶

Releaser is 発売元 in Japanese.

Return type

Optional[str]

parse_distributer()¶

Distributer is 販売元 in Japanese.

Return type

Optional[str]

parse_resale()¶

Parse the product is resale or not.

Return type

bool

parse_images()¶

Parse images of the product.

Return type

List[str]

parse_copyright()¶

Copyright would be something like this © YYYY foo/bar All Rights Reserved.
